page.title: 09CAR-PARKS ON ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: Beside the roads across the Forest are several well-maintained car-parks, mostly sited at high points from which extensive views can be enjoyed. Clearly marked with rustic signs, two of the largest are Gills Lap and King's Standing, named after the nearby pine-clumps. Wooden poles prevent cars from driving beyond the car-park limits. The plastic litter bins, recently introduced by the Wealden District Council, are con- cealed in miniature log cabins and most drivers are careful to use them, though some still throw litter on the ground. In almost any weather there will be ice-cream vans in the larger car-parks, taking up to Â£200 on a fine day at a week-end, when there will probably be over 100 cars around at any one time.
